name: Underscore
description: Displays a list of Underscore methods and its usage

Collection Methods.val: Iterates over a list of elements, yielding each in turn to an iteratee function
Produces a new array of values by mapping each value in list through a transformation function (iteratee)
Reduce boils down a list of values into a single value
Looks through each value in the list, returning the first one that passes a truth test (predicate), or 'undefined' if no value passes the test
Looks through each value in the list, returning an array of all the values that pass a truth test(predicate)
Looks through each value in the list, returning an array of all the values that contain all of the key-value pairs listed in properties
Looks through the list and returns the first value that matches all of the key-value pairs listed in properties
Returns the values in list without the elements that the truth test (predicate) passes
Returns true if all of the values in the list pass the predicate truth test
Returns true if any of the values in the list pass the predicate truth test
Returns true if the value is present in the list
Calls the method named by methodName on each value in the list
Extracts propertyName from each object in present in list
Returns the maximum value in list
Returns the minimum value in list
Returns a (stably) sorted copy of list, ranked in ascending order by the results of running each value through iteratee
Splits a collection into sets, grouped by the result of running each value through iteratee

Array Methods.val: Returns the first element of an array. Passing n will return the first n elements of the array
Returns everything but the last entry of the array. Pass 'n' to exclude the last 'n' elements from the result
Returns the last element of an array. Passing n will return the last n elements of the array
Returns the rest of the elements in an array. Pass an index to return the values of the array from that index onward
Returns a copy of the array with all falsy values removed
Flattens a nested array (deep). If you pass shallow, the array will only be flattened a single level
Returns a copy of the array with all instances of the values removed
Computes the union of the passed-in arrays
Computes the list of values that are the intersection of all the arrays
Returns the values from array that are not present in the other arrays
Produces a duplicate-free version of the array
Merges together the values of each of the arrays with the values at the corresponding position
Returns the index at which value can be found in the array, or -1 if value is not present in the array
Returns the index of the last occurrence of value in the array, or -1 if value is not present
Returns the first index where the predicate truth test passes; otherwise returns -1
A function to create flexibly-numbered lists of integers

Function Methods.val: Bind a function to an object
Binds a number of methods on the object, specified by methodNames, to be run in the context of that object whenever they are invoked
Partially apply a function by filling in any number of its arguments, without changing its dynamic this value
Memoizes a given function by caching the computed result
Defers invoking the function until the current call stack has cleared
Creates and returns a new, throttled version of the passed function
Creates and returns a new debounced version of the passed function which will postpone its execution until after wait milliseconds have elapsed since the last time it was invoked
Creates a version of the function that can only be called one time
Creates a version of the function that will only be run after first being called count times
Creates a version of the function that can be called no more than count times
Wraps the first function inside of the wrapper function, passing it as the first argument
Returns a new negated version of the predicate function
Returns the composition of a list of functions, where each function consumes the return value of the function that follows

Object Methods.val: Retrieve all the names of the object's own enumerable properties
Retrieve all the names of object's own and inherited properties
Return all of the values of the object's own properties
Transform the value of each property in turn
Convert an object into a list of \[key, value\] pairs
Returns a copy of the object where the keys have become the values and the values the keys
Creates a new object with the given prototype, optionally attaching props as own properties
Returns a sorted list of the names of every method in an object
Returns the key where the predicate truth test passes or 'undefined'
Copy all of the properties in the source objects over to the destination object, and return the destination object
Return a copy of the object, filtered to only have values for the whitelisted keys
Return a copy of the object, filtered to omit the blacklisted keys
Fill in undefined properties in object with the first value present in the following list of defaults objects
Create a shallow-copied clone of the provided plain object
Returns 'true' if object contains the 'key' else 'false'
Returns a function that will itself return the key property of any passed-in object
Performs an optimized deep comparison between the two objects, to determine if they should be considered equal
Returns true if an enumerable object contains no values
Returns true if object is a DOM element
Returns true if object is an Array
Returns true if value is an Object
Returns true if object is a Function
Returns true if object is a String
Returns true if object is a Number (including NaN)
Returns true if object is a finite Number
Returns true if object is either true or false
Returns true if the value of object is null

Utility Methods.val: Returns a reference to the Underscore object
Returns the same value that is used as the argument
Creates a function that returns the same value that is used as the argument of _.constant
Returns undefined irrespective of the arguments passed to it
Invokes the given iteratee function n times
Returns a random integer between min and max, inclusive
Allows to extend Underscore with your own utility functions
A mostly-internal function to generate callbacks that can be applied to each element in a collection
Generate a globally-unique id for client-side models or DOM elements that need one
Escapes a string for insertion into HTML
If the value of the named property is a function then invoke it with the object as context; otherwise, return it
Returns an integer timestamp for the current time, using the fastest method available in the runtime
Compiles JavaScript templates into functions that can be evaluated for rendering

Chaining.val: Extracts the value of a wrapped object
